script.name: script
script.description: This is the main element of the script that is required on all DBC files. It is good practice to correctly provide the `author` and `scriptname` attributes so that anyone can determine the purpose of the script and identify the creator of the script.

author.description: The name of the author of the file.

for_demo_only.description: If this attribute is present and defined as *true*, the script is executed only against `MaxDemo` databases and ignored on other cases. The default value is *false*.

for_install_only.description: If this attribute is present and defined as *true*, the script is executed only in install mode and ignored on other cases. The default value is *false*

context.description: The context where this script runs in a Multi-Tenant environment.

tenantcode.description: The code of the tenant where this script runs. This attribute is only considered if **context** is defined as `tenants`.

description.name: description
description.description:
This element provides a meaningful description of the actions taken by the DBC file.
Some examples of valid descriptions of different DBC files are:
- `<description>Inserting authorization for Data Sheet report application</description>`
- `<description>update relationship JOBPLANSPECCLASS and add org/site to unique index jobplanspec_ndx1.  See Java File.</description>`
- `<description>Restores Assign and WMAssign class names to core values, and the same for Scheduler-related fields</description>`
- `<description>Add the new field OPTCLEANUP to the MAPMANAGER table and corntask for delete old SKDOriginDestMatrix</description>`
- `<description>Create a system property to define the maximum time since the last LBS update after which a labor/crew marker should not be displayed using the Nearby Resources Tool</description>`
- `<description>Creating sigoption for enabling the visualization of appointments made flag in the Create WO dialog for GAB.</description>`

check.name: check
check.description:
This section defines the checks to make before running the script. It can have one or more check_query children elements and each one performs an SQL query against the database.
If any query returns a row, the information is logged and usually the script is skipped. The first check that has a query return a row takes precedence. If no query returns rows, the script will be run.
Generally used to skip running the script if the script contents have already been applied.
When a `check_query` needs to register a log message, an internal `MXException` is created and passed to the Maximo logging mechanism. It is possible to pass information to that object using the attributes `group`, `key` and `default`, overriding the default values, as described below:

tag.description: If this attribute is set to `WARNMODIFICATION`, the logged message generated by execution of the check is tagged as a warning, instead of the default `info` tag.

group.description: Defines the Error Group used by the `MXException`.

key.description: Defines the Error Key used by the `MXException`.

default.description: Defines the Error Message used by the `MXException`.

skip_script.description: If `true`, the script runs even if any `check_query` returns any rows.

check_query.name: check_query
check_query.description:
It works in conjunction with check, please read about it first.
Before running a ascript, it is a good practice to always check if the changes of the script were already applied. An example of how to use `check_query` is if a new attribute, called `RELATIONSHIP`, should be added to the object `WFASSIGNMENT`. A safe script should test the existence of the attribute. The `check` and `check_query` elements can be used to validate this pre-condition:
<check>
<check_query>select 1 from maxattribute where objectname = 'WFASSIGNMENT' and attributename = 'RELATIONSHIP'</check_query>
</check>
Another example is before a new object is created, the script should include a check to validate if the object already exists:
<check>
<check_query>select 1 from maxintobject where intobjectname ='MXSCRIPT'</check_query>
</check>
**Note:** Don't include a terminator at the end of the SQL command - `;` or `go`.

statements.name: statements
statements.description:
This element encloses all the elements that represents runnable statements that will perform the necessary changes on database schema or it's data.
Each element runs following the order of appearence inside this tag and, if any error is captured, the update process is aborted and the error is logged.

modify_domain_type.name: modify_domain_type
modify_domain_type.description: This statement allows you to change a Domain's maxtype definition. This definition is applied to all columns that are defined as using the domain.

length.description: Set the length of the maxtype, when appropriate. Must be used only with numeric domains.

scale.description: Set the scale of the maxtype, when appropriate. Must be used only with decimal domains.

define_view.name: define_view
define_view.description:
Creates a database view based on the query defined using table, view_select, view_from and view_where (optional).
The view is associated with a Maximo Business Object (MBO), that must already exists on Maximo Asset Management.

name.description: The name of the new view.

description.description: A meaninful description about the view and why its is necessary.

service.description: The Maximo service associated with the MBO.

classname.description: The fully qualified name of the MBOSet class.

extends.description: If this MBO extends another existing MBO, the name of this MBO can be assigned here.

mainobject.description: Defines if the MBO should be a main object or not.

internal.description: Indicates that the object is reserved for internal use by the platform and cannot be altered by using the Database Configuration application.

autoselect.name: autoselect
autoselect.description: AutoSelect views must reference all columns of the table that the view extends.

table.name: table
table.description: Defines a table that is part of the query present in view_select, view_from and view_where. There must be one table element for each table present in the query.

view_column.name: view_column
view_column.description: Defines a view's column. If the element is not present, the columns are infered from the query.

table.description: Name of the table that contains the column.

view_column.description: Name of the attribute in the view.

same_storage_as.description: Defines this attribute as a alias of another column.

view_select.name: view_select
view_select.description: Defines which columns are returned in the result set and is equivalent to the *select* part of a SQL query. An example is shown in the view_column element and is Used to get only three columns: `sets.setid`, `groupuser.userid` and `applicationauth.app`:

view_from.name: view_from
view_from.description: Defines which tables is part of the query and is equivalent to the *from* part of a SQL query. For examples on how this element is used, see the define_view and view_column elements:

view_where.name: view_where
view_where.description: Defines which data is present on the result set based on SQL-like conditions and is equivalent to the *where* part of a SQL query. For examples on how this element is used, see the define_view and view_column elements:

modify_view.name: modify_view
modify_view.description: Modifies an existing view if the name matches the value of the **name** attribute. This element accepts the same attributes and child elements of define_view.

classname.description: Full Qualified Name (FQN) of the View's object class name.

description.description: Description of the responsibilities of this particular view.

mainobject.description: Object that refers to the the view's based table.

internal.description: Indicates that the object is reserved for internal use by the platform and cannot be altered by using the Database Configuration application.

service.description: Service name if exists one only for this particular app.

drop_view.name: drop_view
drop_view.description: Drops an existing view if the name matches the value of the **name** attribute.

name.description: View's name that should be deleted.

drop_view_attribute.name: drop_view_attribute
drop_view_attribute.description:
Drops a single view's attribute if the name matches the value of the **attribute** attribute.
A modify_view element must be used to remove the dropped attribute from the view's *select*, *from* and *where*.
**Note:** autoselect views can not be modified.

add_view_attribute.name: add_view_attribute
add_view_attribute.description:
Adds a new attribute to an existing view. This attribute must be a column from one of the tables present in the view's query. This element has the same attributes of view_column element.
A modify_view element must be used to add the new attribute to the view's *select*, *from* and *where*, if necessary.
**Note:** autoselect views can not be modified.

table.description: Table name of the based table.

same_storage_as.description: Representes the storage definitions of another existent storage.

modify_view_attributes.name: modify_view_attributes
modify_view_attributes.description:
Modifies one or more attributes of an existing view. It holds a sequence of modify_view_data where each one acts on a single attribute.
**Note:** autoselect views can not be modified.

view.description: View that should have the attributes modified.

modify_view_data.name: modify_view_data
modify_view_data.description: Modifies a single attribute of an existing view. This element has the same attributes of view_column element. It must be used in conjunction with modify_view_attributes.

new_name.description: New name for the particular view.

table.description: Table name of the based table.

same_storage_as.description: Representes the storage definitions of another existent storage.

create_maxvar.name: create_maxvar
create_maxvar.description: Creates a new Maxvar with the given attributes.

description.description: A meaningful description about the Maxvar and why the Maxvar is necessary.

default.description: The default value of the Maxvar, if any.

modify_maxvar.name: modify_maxvar
modify_maxvar.description:
Modifies an existing Maxvar where the name matches the value of the **name** attribute. This element accepts the same attributes of create_maxvar.
The element performs an update on the selected Maxvar and affects only the attributes that are present in the `modify_maxvar` tag, with the exception of the attribute **name**.

description.description: Description about the variable Use.

type.description: Variable type represents the level this variable should be applied [System|Site|Organization].

create_relationship.name: create_relationship
create_relationship.description:
Creates a Maximo relationship between the **parent** and **child** objects that are ruled by the **whereclause** value, a SQL-like that will join **parent** and **child**.
In the where clause, fields that are defined with ":" are the attributes of parent object. The other fields are from child object.

parent.description: Name of the Maximo object indicating *from* where is the relationship.

name.description: Relationship's name, to be used everytime the relationship needs to be referred, as in the presentation xml.

child.description: Name of Maximo object indicating the *to* of the relationship, the target.

whereclause.description: SQL-like where clause of the relationship.

remarks.description: A meaningful description about the relationship.

modify_relationship.name: modify_relationship
modify_relationship.description:
Modifies an existing Maximo relationship where the name matches the value of the **name** attribute. This element accepts the same attributes of create_relationship.
It performs an update on the selected relationship and affects only the attributes present inside `modify_relationship` tag, with the exception of the attribute **name**.

parent.description: Name of the Maximo object indicating *from* where is the relationship.

name.description: Relationship's name, to be used everytime the relationship needs to be referred, as in the presentation xml.

child.description: Name of Maximo object indicating the *to* of the relationship, the target.

whereclause.description: SQL-like where clause of the relationship.

remarks.description: A meaninful description about the relationship.

freeform.name: freeform
freeform.description:
A freeform statement is made of up SQL sections. Each SQL section can have one or more SQL statements, delimited with semicolons. A SQL section can be targeted for specific server types, or all servers.
Since the statement is executed directly on a database server, proceed with extreme caution. The difference in syntax must also be considered when writting the statements. If you cannot create a statement that is compatible with all supported servers, use a sql element for each database product.

description.description: A meaningful description about the changes been made by the SQL statements.

sql.name: sql
sql.description: Works in conjunction with the freeform element and encloses the SQL statement that is executed against the database. Since Maximo Asset Management supports different database products that has different SQL syntaxes, one SQL statement can run successfully on one platform but not on another.  In this case, use the  **target** attribute to define the scope of this statement.

target.description: Defines when the statements must be executed, based on the underlying database configuration. It's possible to have product-specific statements, such as `oracle` for Oracle statements, statements that run on all products except one, like `not_db2` and statements that run on all products (`all`).

define_table.name: define_table
define_table.description:
Creates a database table.
The table is associated to a Maximo Business Object (MBO) that must already exists on Maximo Asset Management.

object.description: Table's name that is used everytime the table needs to be referred.

description.description: A meaningful description about the view and why the view is necessary.

service.description: The Maximo service that is associated with the MBO.

classname.description: The fully qualified name of the MBOSet class.

persistent.description: Defines if the MBO is persistent or not.

primarykey.description: A comma-separeted list of columns names that represents the table's primary key.

mainobject.description: Defines if the MBO should be a main object or not.

internal.description: Sets the internal field of MBO.

trigroot.description: Each Maximo table includes a column named ROWSTAMP, for this columns, the trigeroot must be set in order to autaticaly fill it.

storagetype.description: Defines the Storage Types for Multitenancy used by the DBChange code.

resource_type.description: Only used for tables's representing the WEATHERAPI resources.

modify_table.name: modify_table
modify_table.description:
Above, in the list for type, organization and orgwithsite are deprecated and are kept only so existing scripts can be used.
In the statement run method, organization will be converted to org and orgwithsite converted to orgsite.
The list of storagetype comes from the MTStorageType class. That list must correspond to this list.

description.description: Brief description that should replace the original one.

service.description: The Maximo service associated with the MBO.

classname.description: The fully qualified name of the MBOSet class.

drop_table.name: drop_table
drop_table.description: Drop an object/table (created previously by a define_table statement)

object.description: Table's name, to be used everytime the table needs to be referred.

add_attributes.name: add_attributes
add_attributes.description: Adds new attributes to an existing object/table (created previously by a define_table statement).

attrmod.name: attrmod
attrmod.description: Defines each attribute should be modified/added and should be configured as a nested element into the add_attribute.

length.description: The number of characters that can be entered into this attribute.

persistent.description: Defines if the attribute is persistent or not.

haslongdesc.description: If the attribute has a log description, this should be set.

required.description: When set to **TRUE**, indicates that a value is required in this field.

userdefined.description: Inform to Maximo that this attribute was defined/added by user.

domain.description: Associate this attribute with a domain through the domain's name

classname.description: Associate to this attribute with a field validation class trhough the class's FQN (Full Qualified Name).

defaultvalue.description: Defines a default value for the attribute.

title.description: Define a clear, short column identifier to be substituted in messages, screen labels, etc.

remarks.description: A brief description or a remark about the attribute's purpose.

sameasobject.description: SameAsObject indicate the master object that controls the maxtype, length, and scale of this attribute.

sameasattribute.description: SameAsAttribute indicate the master attribute that controls the maxtype, length, and scale of this attribute.

mustbe.description: When checked, indicates that Maxtype, Length, and Scale of the attribute can NOT be changed. When cleared, indicates that they can be changed.

ispositive.description: For a numeric field, when checked, only positive values (and zero) are allowed; when cleared, both positive and negative values are allowed.

autokey.description: Defines the autokey for this field.

canautonum.description: Defines if this attribute can use a trigger.

searchtype.description: Indicates to Maximo what kind of search type is allowed for this attribute.

localizable.description: Defines if this attribute is localized or not.

domainlink.description: Defines if the value should be norrow down by another domain.

modify_attribute.name: modify_attribute
modify_attribute.description: Modifies an attribute from an existing object/table (created previously by a define_table; add_attributes statements

length.description: The number of characters that can be entered into this attribute.

persistent.description: Defines if the attribute is persistent or not.

haslongdesc.description: If the attribute has a log description, this should be set.

required.description: When set to **TRUE**, indicates that a value is required in this field.

userdefined.description: Inform to Maximo that this attribute was defined/added by user.

domain.description: Associate this attribute with a domain through the domain's name.

classname.description: Associate to this attribute with a field validation class trhough the class's FQN (Full Qualified Name).

defaultvalue.description: Defines a default value for the attribute.

title.description: Define a clear, short column identifier to be substituted in messages, screen labels, etc.

remarks.description: A brief description or a remark about the attribute's purpose.

sameasobject.description: SameAsObject indicate the master object that controls the maxtype, length, and scale of this attribute.

sameasattribute.description: SameAsAttribute indicate the master attribute that controls the maxtype, length, and scale of this attribute.

mustbe.description: When checked, indicates that Maxtype, Length, and Scale of the attribute can NOT be changed. When cleared, indicates that they can be changed.

ispositive.description: For a numeric field, when checked, only positive values (and zero) are allowed; when cleared, both positive and negative values are allowed.

autokey.description: Defines the autokey for this field.

canautonum.description: Defines if this attribute can use a trigger.

searchtype.description: Indicates to Maximo what kind of search type is allowed for this attribute.

localizable.description: Defines if this attribute is localized or not.

domainlink.description: Defines if the value should be norrow down by another domain.

drop_attributes.name: drop_attributes
drop_attributes.description: Drop an attribute according with its name.

attrname.name: attrname
attrname.description: Used nested to the drop_attribute element.

attrdef.name: attrdef
attrdef.description: The **attrdef** element is nested to add_attributes element and serves to specify each attribute that should be added in a particular table, view or object.

length.description: The number of characters that can be entered into this attribute.

persistent.description: Defines if the attribute is persistent or not.

haslongdesc.description: If the attribute has a log description, this should be set.

required.description: When set to **TRUE**, indicates that a value is required in this field.

userdefined.description: Inform to Maximo that this attribute was defined/added by user.

domain.description: Associate this attribute with a domain through the domain's name

classname.description: Associate to this attribute with a field validation class trhough the class's FQN (Full Qualified Name).

defaultvalue.description: Defines a default value for the attribute.

title.description: Define a clear, short column identifier to be substituted in messages, screen labels, etc.

remarks.description: A brief description or a remark about the attribute's purpose.

sameasobject.description: SameAsObject indicate the master object that controls the maxtype, length, and scale of this attribute.

sameasattribute.description: SameAsAttribute indicate the master attribute that controls the maxtype, length, and scale of this attribute.

mustbe.description: When checked, indicates that Maxtype, Length, and Scale of the attribute can NOT be changed. When cleared, indicates that they can be changed.

ispositive.description: For a numeric field, when checked, only positive values (and zero) are allowed; when cleared, both positive and negative values are allowed.

autokey.description: Defines the autokey for this field.

canautonum.description: Defines if this attribute can use a trigger.

searchtype.description: Indicates to Maximo what kind of search type is allowed for this attribute.

localizable.description: Defines if this attribute is localized or not.

domainlink.description: Defines if the value should be norrow down by another domain.

specify_index.name: specify_index
specify_index.description: Use *specify* to modify an existing index or bring new a one into existence

object.description: Object's or Table's name wich should have the index specified.

primary.description: Indicates if this index contains or is a primary key.

unique.description: **TRUE** or **FALSE** values indicating that this is a unique index.

clustered.description: Indicates if this index is clustered or not

required.description: Indicates if the index field is required or not.

addtenantid.description: Associate this index with the table's tenant id.

drop_index.name: drop_index
drop_index.description: Drop index by name or definition.

object.description: Object's name of the target index.

indexkey.name: indexkey
indexkey.description: The indexkey element is a nested part of the specify_index and drop_index elements.

column.description: Attribute name associated with this index.

description.description: Description of the domain's value.

length.description: Defines the number of characters allowed to be inputed by the user.

internal.description: Flag to indicate if the domain is internal and/or localizable. 0: localizable and not internal; 1: internal and not localizable; 2: not localizable but not internal.

add_synonyms.name: add_synonyms
add_synonyms.description: Add a new synonym to an existent synonyms domain ( created (created previously by a specify_synonym_domain;

synonymvalueinfo.name: synonymvalueinfo
synonymvalueinfo.description: Defines the synonym domain's value. This element is used nested to specify_synonym_domain and add_synonyms elements.

description.description: Brief description about the value itself.

specify_aln_domain.name: specify_aln_domain
specify_aln_domain.description: Specifies a **ALN** domain, a domain that handle directly with maxtypes.

description.description: Description of the domain's value.

length.description: Defines the number of characters allowed to be inputed by the user.

internal.description: Flag to indicate if the domain is internal and/or localizable. 0: localizable and not internal; 1: internal and not localizable; 2: not localizable but not internal.

specify_numeric_domain.name: specify_numeric_domain
specify_numeric_domain.description: Specifies a **numeric** domain. A numeric domain works with **AMOUNT**,**DECIMAL**,**DURATION**,**FLOAT**,**INTEGER** or a **SMALLINT** values, those values should be set through the **maxtype** attribute.

description.description: Description of the domain's value.

length.description: Defines the number of characters allowed to be inputed by the user.

scale.description: Scale of the numeric domain value for numeric domains.

internal.description: Flag to indicate if the domain is internal and/or localizable. 0: localizable and not internal; 1: internal and not localizable; 2: not localizable but not internal.

specify_crossover_domain.name: specify_crossover_domain
specify_crossover_domain.description: A crossover domain will allow additional values to be carried or "crossed" over from a child table when a field is populated in a parent table, with data that connects the two tables based on a where clause that creates a one to one relationship between the two objects.

description.description: Description of the domain's value.

validationwhereclause.description: The Validation Where Clause is critical to the crossover functioning and defines the one to one relationship between the two objects that will trigger the crossover when that criteria is met

listwhereclause.description: Where clause used to get list members

errorbundle.description: Resource bundle of message to be returned if value fails to match domain

errorkey.description: Key to access error message (displayed if value not in domain)

objectname.description: The Object value should be the child table and is the object the value will be brought over from.

internal.description: Flag to indicate if the domain is internal and/or localizable. 0: localizable and not internal; 1: internal and not localizable; 2: not localizable but not internal.

specify_table_domain.name: specify_table_domain
specify_table_domain.description: Defines a table domain.  You do add a table domain when you want to add a domain that draws its values directly from a column in the database. This process creates a dynamic value list because the values it draws from the database might change.

description.description: Description of the domain's value.

validationwhereclause.description: The Validation Where Clause is critical to the crossover functioning and defines the one to one relationship between the two objects that will trigger the crossover when that criteria is met

listwhereclause.description: Type the part of the clause that specifies the values that you want to select based on the validation WHERE clause.

errorbundle.description: Resource bundle of message to be returned if value fails to match domain

errorkey.description: Key to access error message (displayed if value not in domain)

objectname.description: The Object value should be the child table and is the object the value will be brought over from.

internal.description: Flag to indicate if the domain is internal and/or localizable. 0: localizable and not internal; 1: internal and not localizable; 2: not localizable but not internal.

description.description: Description about the ALN domain value.

numericvalueinfo.name: numericvalueinfo
numericvalueinfo.description: Defines the numeric domain's value. This element is used nested to specify_numeric_domain elements.

description.description: Brief description about the value itself.

crossovervalueinfo.name: crossovervalueinfo
crossovervalueinfo.description: It is critical to enter the proper value for the crossover to work. the `crossovervalueinfo` defines more than one source and destination pairing for one crossover domain.

sourcefield.description: Field from which a user will copy the database field value

destfield.description: Field to which a user will copy the database field value

copyevenifsrcnull.description: Boolean value, if true, the destination attribute will also be set to NULL when the source attribute is `NULL` or empty. If false, the destination attribute will be left as what it is when the source attribute is NULL or empty.

copyonlyifdestnull.description: Boolean value, when it is `TRUE`, the value of the source attribute will only be set to destination attribute when the destination attribute's value is `NULL` or empty.

add_sigoption.name: add_sigoption
add_sigoption.description:
`grantapp` and `grantoption` determine what groups should be granted application authorization for the new `sigoption`. If the grant is based on `STARTCNTR.READ`, then groups that have READ access to the Start Center will be authorized for the new option when the script is run.
`granteveryone` will grant the sigoption to the all users group.
`grantcondition` will apply the condition to all ApplicationAuth records created.
`langcode` is not longer required, and actually this setting will be ignored.
The code for the base language of the database will be used.
The attribute is only kept to allow existing scripts to be valid.
Attributes: 
- **app:** Signature Option Application Name.
- **optionname:** Signature Option Name.
- **decription:** Signature Option Description.
- **esigenabled:** Indicates Electronic Signature (ESIG) is enabled for this function.
- **visible:** Indicates whether this sigoption can be granted via the Security Groups application. It will be visible and grantable if the value is 1 and not visible if the value is 0. If it is not visible, it should be granted and revoked along with another application by listing it in the `ALSOGRANTS` and `ALSOREVOKES` columns.
- **alsogrants:** List of other sigoptions that will be automatically granted when this sigoption is selected.
- **alsorevokes:** List of other sigoptions that will be automatically revoked when this sigoption is deselected.
- **prerequisite:** List of other sigoptions that must be selected before this sigoption can be selected.
- **langcode:** Language Column.
- **grantapp:** List of applications that will be automatically granted when this sigoption is selected.
- **grantoption:** Signature Option that will be automatically granted when this sigoption is selected.
- **granteveryone:**  Automatically granted access for everyone when this sigoption is selected.
- **grantcondition:** Non-persistent field used by the Security Groups application to populate restrictions assigned to a Security Group that are eventually stored in the `APPLICATIONAUTH` table.

esigenabled.description: Indicates Electronic Signature (ESIG) is enabled for this function.

visible.description: Indicates whether this sigoption can be granted via the Security Groups application. It will be visible and grantable if the value is 1 and not visible if the value is 0. If it is not visible, it should be granted and revoked along with another application by listing it in the `ALSOGRANTS` and `ALSOREVOKES` columns.

alsogrants.description: List of other sigoptions that will be automatically granted when this sigoption is selected.

alsorevokes.description: List of other sigoptions that will be automatically revoked when this sigoption is deselected.

prerequisite.description: List of other sigoptions that must be selected before this sigoption can be selected.

grantapp.description: List of applications that will be automatically granted when this sigoption is selected.

grantoption.description: Signature Option that will be automatically granted when this sigoption is selected.

granteveryone.description: Automatically granted access for everyone when this sigoption is selected.

grantcondition.description: Non-persistent field used by the Security Groups application to populate restrictions assigned to a Security Group that are eventually stored in the `APPLICATIONAUTH` table.

create_module.name: create_module
create_module.description: Create a module application that incorporetes a group of applications menus.

description.description: Maximo Module Description

menu_position.description: Maximo Module's position at the module menu.

menu_param.description: If exists, a menu param that enables some app to work with a data start point.

image.description: Reference for a menu image that represents the module fuctions.

modify_module.name: modify_module
modify_module.description: Modifies a module existent module application.

description.description: Maximo Module Description

menu_position.description: Maximo  Module's position at the menu.

image.description: Reference for a menu image that represents the module fuctions.

module_app.name: module_app
module_app.description: Create a module for an specific application.

menu_position.description: Maximo Module's position at the menu.

menu_pos_param.description: Name of the app or optionname. Will be null if this is a header.

image.description: Reference for a menu image that represents the module fuctions.

drop_module.name: drop_module
drop_module.description: Drop a specific module. Dropping an app will also drop related sigoption and maxmenu entries

description.description: Brief description about the application functionality.

maintbname.description: Main Object name (table or view) for APP used to get JAVA MBO set.

modify_app.name: modify_app
modify_app.description: Modify an existent app created by create_app element.

description.description: Brief description about the application functionality.

maintbname.description: Main Object name (table or view) for APP used to get JAVA MBO set.

drop_app.name: drop_app
drop_app.description: Drop a specific application. Dropping an app will also drop related `sigoption` and `maxmenu` entries

module_menu_app.name: module_menu_app
module_menu_app.description: Nested element from module_app and create_module, where the menu for applications will be defined as well as images will be associated wiht defined menus.

image.description: Associated image that will represents the application among the module hyperlinks.

module_menu_header.name: module_menu_header
module_menu_header.description: Defines a menu header for a module/submodule application. This is an nested element, present on create_module root element.

headerdescription.description: Header description. Will be null if this is not a header.

create_app_menu.name: create_app_menu
create_app_menu.description: This statement creates a new menu for an specific application in Maximo.

app_menu_option.name: app_menu_option
app_menu_option.description: Defines a menu into a application menu structure.

option.description: Option's name associated to a Maximo Application.

image.description: Application associated image/icon that will be shown at the UI.

tabdisplay.description: Indicates the tabs on which an option can be displayed (i.e. `LIST`|`ALL`|`MAIN`).

menu_separator.name: menu_separator
menu_separator.description: Add a menu separator to a existent menu in the structure.

tabdisplay.description: Indicates the tabs on which an option can be displayed (i.e. `LIST`|`ALL`|`MAIN`).

app_menu_header.name: app_menu_header
app_menu_header.description: Defines a header/Submenu for a menu application.

headerdescription.description: Description of the header of a sub menu that represents some group of apps.

image.description: Application associated image/icon that will be shown at the UI.

tabdisplay.description: Indicates the tabs on which an option can be displayed (i.e. `LIST`|`ALL`|`MAIN`).

additional_app_menu.name: additional_app_menu
additional_app_menu.description: This statement adds more menu stuff to an existing application menu.

menu_position.description: Menu application position at the menu list.

pos_param.description: Name of the app or optionname. Will be null if this is a header.

add_service.name: add_service
add_service.description: Add a service wich will bind through a RMI service remote and local requisitions.

description.description: Description of the service purposes.

classname.description: Full Qualifiend Name for the java class that implements the service.

singleton.description: Specifies whether the session is singleton or can be different for tenant.

description.description: Description of the service purposes.

classname.description: Full Qualifiend Name for the java class that implements the service.

singleton.description: Specifies whether the session is singleton or can be different for tenant.

add_property.name: add_property
add_property.description: Add a system property to be configured through the UI.

description.description: Brief description of this property.

scope.description: Represents the use scope of the property (i.e. `global`, `instance` or `open`).

secure_level.description: Indicates the level of access permitted for this property (i.e. `private`, `public`, `secure` or `mtsecure`)

live_refresh.description: Indicates whether live refresh of cache is supported for this property.

required.description: When checked, indicates that a value is required for this property.

online_changes.description: Indicates whether the user is allowed to override the value via the Property application.

user_defined.description: Indicates whether this property was delivered with Maximo or was defined by a user.

encrypted.description: Indicates whether the value of the property should be encrypted when stored on the MaxPropValue table.

masked.description: Identified whether this value is masked in the System Properties application

accesstype.description: Access Type (i.e. master = **0**, landlord = **1**, delta = **2**, tenant = **3** )

set_property.name: set_property
set_property.description: Set a value to an existent property.

longdescription.name: longdescription
longdescription.description:
Enable or disable a long description for an aln field. 
#

insert.name: insert
insert.description: Will insert a new row to a Table in Maximo.

selectwhere.description: Where clause to list the data from source table.

ignore_duplicates.description: If checked `TRUE`will allow the user to insert duplicate data.

insertrow.name: insertrow
insertrow.description:
Intert a row in an specif table through the insert element. 
#

columnvalue.name: columnvalue
columnvalue.description: Defines the parameter to insert a new row to into a table through the inser and insertrow elements.

string.description: String value that will be set to the new row.

boolean.description: Boolean value that will be set to the new row.

number.description: Numeric value that will be set to the new row.

date.description: Date value that will be set to the new row.

defaultsynonym.description: Default domain that will be set to the new row.

logical_relationship.name: logical_relationship
logical_relationship.description:
Persist an existent relationship in a logical relationship when necessary in a relational database. (Frequently used when huges ammount of data are deleted and 
the database clains for reorg and reindex commands from the database)

object.description: Table's name, to be used everytime the table needs to be referred.

keys.description: Primary keys of the referred table.

targetobj.description: Table's name of the target table in this relationship.

targetkeys.description: Primary keys for the target table or foren keys in this relationship.

description.description: A brief description of what the relationship is capable of

number.description: Specifies the cardinality of the relationship
